business.headline: Tata Group quietly becomes Tesla's global supplier: ReportTata firms have already signed global agreements with Tesla and are supplying various parts and services and their involvement is expected to grow further.

Unified Pension Scheme: Who can join and how much to contributeUPS will be available to central government employees who meet specific criteria. This includes existing employees under NPS as of 1st April 2025. It also includes newly recruited employees joining central government services on or after April 1, 2025.
Is AI smart enough to help you make money on stock market?One of the major advantages of using AI is that it takes care of the labour-intensive aspects of trading efficiently, as per experts.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to fix economic crisisNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Sensex climbs over 600 points. Check key reasons behind stock market rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 604.77 points to trade at 76,952.83 at 12:37 pm, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 175.35 points to 23,366. Adding to the cheer was the continued rally in smallcap and midcap segments.

Bajaj Finance shares rally over 3% to reach record high, analysts bullishShares of the non-banking financial company rose 3.5% in early trade to reach a day's high of 9,070. At around 10:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.43% higher at Rs 8,891.15 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).
RVNL shares rise 4% as railway PSU bags Rs 555 crore project. Check detailsThe shares of RVNL were trading 4.18% higher at Rs 373 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

This woman earned $350 million a day but lost $3.6 billion in 3 daysMarina Bumdiman had accumulated a fortune of $7.5 billion, making her the richest woman in Indonesia. However, the rapid rise was followed by an equally sharp fall. In just three days, her net worth was cut in half, wiping out $3.6 billion.

Ola Electric shares jump over 6% after clarification on February sales dataOla Electric Mobility's share price rose over 6% on the Bombay Stock Exchange in early trade after an important clarification.

Accenture revenue forecast hits IT stocks, Infosys, Wipro fallAccenture, which is seen as a key indicator for the Indian IT sector, raised the lower end of its annual revenue forecast but kept the upper end unchanged.
Sensex, Nifty open lower as IT stocks drag markets down after 4-day rallyThe S&P BSE Sensex was down 98.30 points to 76,249.76, while the NSE Nifty50 lost 21.85 points to 23,168.80 as of 9:25 am.

Ola Electric explains February sales mismatch: Temporary backlog in registrationsOla Electric addressed concerns about the mismatch in a stock exchange filing, saying that daily registrations have now exceeded 50% of its three-month daily sales average.

entertainment.headline: Jay-Z, Beyonce consider legal action against Kanye West targets their childrenJay-Z and Beyonce are reportedly exploring legal options against Kanye West. This follows a controversial post by West regarding their children.

BTS' J-hope releases Mona Lisa music video, a playful single that's Hobie coded J-hope of BTS launched a new music video, Mona Lisa, which has funky beats and dynamic dance moves. It's a visual feast.

Dhanashree's song on infidelity, domestic abuse post divorce from Yuzvendra ChahalChoregrapher Dhanashree Verma released a new song titled 'Dekha Ji Dekha Maine' on the same day she was granted a divorce from cricketer Yuzvendra Chahal.

Ranbir Kapoor talks about his 'first wife'. No, it isn't Alia BhattRanbir Kapoor shared a bizarre fan story, revealing that a girl once arrived with a Pandit at his bungalow to get married to him. He later joked about meeting his 'first wife.'

Sonakshi Sinha on life with Zaheer Iqbal: Haven't wasted a day since I met himSonakshi Sinha shared a heart-warming 'husband appreciation post' for Zaheer Iqbal, calling him her source of laughter. The couple got married in June 2024.

Mahesh Babu's son Gautam performs mime at New York college, excited fans reactActor Mahesh Babu's son is studying dramatics at New York University. In a video shared by a fan-club, he is seen performing a mime with a girl. The video has now gone viral on social media.

Naga Chaitanya roasts Sobhita Dhulipala: You lack basic human skillsSobhita Dhulipala and Naga Chaitanya shared fun relationship insights, from who apologises first to who is more dramatic when sick. The couple got married in December 2024 in a traditional ceremony.

Mohanlal's Empuraan scripts history in pre-sales, set for a grand openingMohanlal's L2: Empuraan is taking the box office by storm in its pre-sales. According to initial reports, the film has grossed over Rs 12 crore only in the international market.

One Battle After Another teaser: Leonardo DiCaprio brings grit, gunfire in actionerThe teaser trailer of Paul Thomas Anderson's upcoming film with Leonardo DiCaprio was released. Titled One Battle After Another, the action-thriller is set for a September 2025 release.

Aamir Khan's family 'happy' about his relationship with Gauri, says sister NikhatAamir Khan's sister, Nikhat Hegde, said she is happy with his relationship with Gauri Spratt. She also praised Gauri and wished for the couple to stay happy forever.

Kanneda review: Parmish Varma is fantastic in gangster drama beyond guns and goons Released-Fri Mar 21, 2025'Kanneda' is a breath of fresh air in the Indian OTT scene. Singer and actor Parmish Verma bowls you over as an underdog-turned-drug-lord in the 90s 'Kanneda' of the Punjabi immigrants.

Adolescence highlights 'growing problem', must screen in schools: UK Prime MinisterThe UK Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, backed the call for screening Netflix's show Adolescence in schools. The four-part show sheds light on the growing influence of social media on teenage boys.

Adolescence was meant to be a why, not a whodunnit: Actor Stephen GrahamActor Stephen Graham discussed his latest Netflix series, Adolescence, on The Tonight Show. He highlighted how today's generation is exposed to all the information on social media, increasing social accountability. The Netflix series aims to spark a conversation on social influence.

Mahesh Babu's daughter Sitara teaches him Gen-Z lingo in their first collaborationMahesh Babu and his daughter Sitara appeared in their first-ever on-screen collaboration for a clothing brand. In the fun comercial, Sitara can be seen teaching Mahesh Babu Gen-Z words.

Chiranjeevi condemns unauthorised paid fan meets in UK, says no to exploitationMegastar Chiranjeevi warned his fans in United Kingdom about middlemen trying to charge them fees for fan meets. In a post on X, he condemned this behaviour and promised refunds.

Kendall Jenner criticizes Khloe Kardashian's 'cold' behavior towards Lamar OdomKendall Jenner criticized Khloe Kardashian's 'cold' and 'snarky' behavior during her reunion with Lamar Odom. She compared it to Khloe's treatment of Tristan Thompson and admitted she cried watching the episode.

Hollywood release shake-up: Warner Bros. reschedules major films for box office successWarner Bros. has rescheduled major releases, pushing The Bride to 2026 and One Battle After Another to September 2025. These moves aim to boost box office earnings and enhance awards season positioning.

Comedian Samay Raina postpones India tour amid India's Got Latent rowComedian Samay Raina shared a note in his Instagram stories, announcing that he has postponed his India tour. His decision comes weeks after he found himself in the middle of a controversy involving podcaster Ranveer Allahabadia's comments on his YouTube show, 'India's Got Latent'.

Lollapalooza 2025 lineup announced: Olivia Rodrigo, A$AP Rocky, and moreLollapalooza 2025's lineup includes Olivia Rodrigo, A$AP Rocky, Sabrina Carpenter, and Korn. The festival runs from July 31 and promises another exciting mix of top artists.

general news.headline: Muslim quota bill passed in Karnataka, BJP MLAs tear copy, throw at SpeakerAmid uproar in the Karnataka Assembly over the honey trap case, the Congress passed a Bill granting 4 per cent reservation for Muslims in government contracts, sparking controversy. Congress defended it as inclusive, while the BJP called it unconstitutional and vowed to challenge it legally.

Fire at Delhi judge's bungalow leads to huge cash recovery; he gets transferredJustice Yashwant Verma was sent back to his parent court following the recommendation of the Supreme Court Collegium after the incident came to light.

Disha Salian's father's lawyer claims eyewitnesses against Aaditya ThackerayAdvocate Nilesh Ojha said he had full trust in Chief Minister Devendra Fadnavis, but not in the Special Investigation Team (SIT) probing Disha Salian's death.

Meerut woman posed as lover's dead mother on Snapchat, said husband be killed: CopsIn a bizarre twist to the case, Muskan had created three fake Snapchat ID under the name of her brother. She used this account to send messages, convincing Sahil that his mother was speaking to him from the afterlife.

Saurabh Bharadwaj is AAP's new Delhi convenor, Manish Sisodia gets Punjab taskSaurabh Bharadwaj is AAP's new Delhi convenor, Manish Sisodia appointed Punjab incharge in key meet.

Milind Deora slams Mounjaro's launch, calls for higher sugar taxesRajya Sabha member Milind Deora has criticised the launch of Mounjaro in India. The weight-loss drug, developed by US-based Eli Lilly, is a weekly injectable medicine that costs Rs 3,500 for the 2.5 mg vial.

UPI services will be suspended on some mobile numbers from April 1. Details hereThe NPCI will start delinking UPI IDs linked to inactive mobile numbers from April 1, 2025, potentially disrupting digital payments for affected users. To avoid issues, ensure your bank records are updated with your current mobile number.

Did you know that ICSE exam papers were checked in England until 1970s?ICSE exam papers were set and corrected in England until 1970, decades after independence. The shift to an Indian evaluation system marked a break from colonial control over education.

Pakistan plans to legalise cryptocurrency to tackle economic slowdownNearly 15-20 million Pakistanis are already trading digital assets. Further, countries like the US and UAE are embracing crypto-friendly policies, making it crucial for Pakistan to stay competitive.

Anand Mahindra's stern reply to X user who claimed old video he shared is 'scripted'The video in question was first posted on Instagram by Seenu Malik, a content creator, as part of his "365 Good Day Challenge" in August 2024.

Honey trap row disrupts Karnataka assembly again, BJP MLAs storm well of HouseThe scandal about political leaders in Karnataka being honey-trapped continued to dog the proceedings in the Assembly. On Friday, BJP leaders held up CDs, implying these were tools used to extract information and blackmail.

UK's Heathrow Airport closed for 24 hours after huge fire at substationLondon's Heathrow Airport on Friday announced that it will remain shut for at least 24 hours after a fire at a nearby electrical substation caused a significant power outage. All arrival and departure flights to the airport have been cancelled.

Trump warns Tesla vandals could face 20 years in prison: We are looking for youFollowing a string of attacks on Tesla, US President Donald Trump on Friday warned that those targeting the automobile company could face up to twenty years in jail.

Can a parent's affair shape a child's emotional world?For a child who is in his teens or pre-teens and struggling with numerous things like puberty, peers, and relationships, the revelation of a parent's affair can be a blow big enough to shape how the person grows up emotionally.

How Indian personal care market is making even better business senseNewer growth areas, such as serums, hair masks, mists and facial oils, lead the charge as consumers get more self-aware and discretionary spending rises

Air India passenger found dead with seatbelt still fastened after flight landsThe Air India passenger had not unfastened his seatbelt, indicating that he had died midair. The exact cause of death will be ascertained after postmortem, police said.

Judge blocks Trump move to deport Indian student over alleged Hamas linkThe Department of Homeland Security has accused Badar Khan Suri of ties to the Palestinian militant group Hamas and said he had spread Hamas propaganda and antisemitism on social media.

Report shows Karnataka leads with country's richest MLAs amid salary hike rowA report by Association for Democratic Reforms shows that Karnataka leads India with 31 billionaire MLAs, followed by Andhra Pradesh and Maharashtra. Despite having the wealthiest MLAs, the  Congress-led government has proposed a bill to give hefty salary and allowance hikes to the legislators.

R Ashwin meets D Gukesh at Chepauk, plays chess with world championIPL 2025: R Ashwin gave D Gukesh a CSK jersey and also played chess with the youngest world champion. Ashwin has returned to playing for CSK since last playing for them way back in 2015.

sports.headline: Sankar Subramanian, 21, stuns World No.2 Antonsen for massive win in BaselSwiss Open 2025: 21-year-old Sankar Subramanian Muthusamy stunned World No. 2 Anders Antonsen to reach the men's singles quarterfinals. The former junior World No. 1 fought back from a game down in Basel on Thursday.

R Ashwin meets D Gukesh at Chepauk, plays chess with world championIPL 2025: R Ashwin gave D Gukesh a CSK jersey and also played chess with the youngest world champion. Ashwin has returned to playing for CSK since last playing for them way back in 2015.

Forget the past, believe in yourself: Sreesanth backs Umran to bounce backIPL 2025: S Sreesanth, speaking to IndiaToday.in, urged young fast bowlers, including Umran Malik, to prioritise fitness, smart training, and recovery for sustained success. Backing Umran to make a strong comeback from injury setbacks, the former fast bowler urged young pacers in the country to believe they can win matches for India.

Suryakumar Yadav's Mumbai Indians reach Chennai before CSK clashIPL 2025: Suryakumar Yadav's Mumbai Indians (MI) reached Chennai on Thursday night before their opening game against five-time champions Chennai Super Kings on March 23 at the MA Chidambaram Stadium.

BCCI abolishes rule of banning captains for over-rate offencesIPL 2025: The BCCI did away with the rule of banning captains for over-rate offences with the decision being taken in the captains' meeting at the BCCI headquarters in Mumbai on Thursday.

Fans enjoy Virat Kohli's batting session before curtain raiserIPL 2025: RCB veteran Virat Kohli practised wholeheartedly at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata before the tournament opener as the fans enjoyed watching him bat in the training session.

Will KKR captain Ajinkya Rahane silence doubters in new season?KKR decided to take the bold call of having Ajinkya Rahane as their skipper for the new season. With many doubting his credentials, can Rahane silence his critics and lead KKR to glory?

Kirsty Coventry becomes 1st female president of Olympic body, Jay Shah leads wishesInternational Cricket Council (ICC) President Jay Shah congratulated the newly elected President of the International Olympic Committee Kirsty Coventry, who also became the first woman to hold the position.
NCAA Tournament: Fordham sacks Keith Urgo over recruiting violations chargesFordham parted ways with basketball coach Keith Urgo amid charges of recruiting violations.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
